blocked.short_desc: CVE-2013-6403 owncloud: possible security bypass on admin page (5.0.13)

long_desc.thetext:
ownCloud 5.0.13 fixes a possible security issue:

""
http://owncloud.org/changelog/
SECURITY: Fix a possible security bypass on admin page under certain circumstances and MariaDB
""

I do not know if this flaw affects the older versions in Fedora and EPEL.

Created owncloud tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1035593]
Affects: epel-6 [bug 1035594]
CVE request: http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/11/28/5
F18 has 4.x but is EOL in a month, F19 and F20 are on 5.0.13 already (I'm about to send out 5.0.14a).
Sorry, I miscounted - F19 is still on 4.5.

The version in the epel repository (4.5) isn't supported by upstream. Version 5 is already  in the fedora repository, please upgrade.
we are working on it, but it's not a simple switch.

(In reply to Adam Williamson from comment #1)
> we are working on it, but it's not a simple switch.

Any progress for it? Any repo with the current WIP?

"Any progress for it?"

currently kinda blocking on https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/6310 . Looking into what's going screwy there in more detail is on my todo list, but underneath QA stuff :/

"Any repo with the current WIP?"

Rawhide; you'll need to rebuild owncloud itself plus various deps, at least doctrine-dbal and I think something else. I'm running the Rawhide packages rebuilt for F20 on my personal server, haven't tested on RHEL at all.
sorry, wrong bug reference. Correct one is https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/7778 .

Apart from above issue there are just a few runtime deps missing on el6:

Error: Package: owncloud-6.0.3-1.el6.noarch (/owncloud-6.0.3-1.el6.noarch)
           Requires: php-pear(Sabre_CalDAV) >= 1.7.8
           Available: php-sabredav-Sabre_CalDAV-1.6.4-3.el6.noarch (epel)
               php-pear(Sabre_CalDAV) = 1.6.4
Error: Package: owncloud-6.0.3-1.el6.noarch (/owncloud-6.0.3-1.el6.noarch)
           Requires: php-irodsphp
Error: Package: owncloud-6.0.3-1.el6.noarch (/owncloud-6.0.3-1.el6.noarch)
           Requires: php-pear(Sabre_CardDAV) >= 1.7.8
           Available: php-sabredav-Sabre_CardDAV-1.6.5-2.el6.noarch (epel)
               php-pear(Sabre_CardDAV) = 1.6.5
Error: Package: owncloud-6.0.3-1.el6.noarch (/owncloud-6.0.3-1.el6.noarch)
           Requires: php-pear(phpseclib.sourceforge.net/Net_SFTP)

I'm gonna push a build into updates-testing where we can assemble the update and issue any missing packages. Btw. I don't think the postgresql problem is blocking as long as mysql and sqlite works. maybe we should just drop the pgsql subpkg for the time being until it works again?
then what's our story for people with deployed instances with pgsql databases? migrate your database? stay on 4.x?

bugs.title: owncloud dependencies are missing from epel6

bugzilla.short_desc: owncloud dependencies are missing from epel6

long_desc.thetext: The version in the epel repository (4.5) isn't supported by upstream. Version 5 is already  in the fedora repository, please upgrade.
we are working on it, but it's not a simple switch.

(In reply to Adam Williamson from comment #1)
> we are working on it, but it's not a simple switch.

Any progress for it? Any repo with the current WIP?

"Any progress for it?"

currently kinda blocking on https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/6310 . Looking into what's going screwy there in more detail is on my todo list, but underneath QA stuff :/

"Any repo with the current WIP?"

Rawhide; you'll need to rebuild owncloud itself plus various deps, at least doctrine-dbal and I think something else. I'm running the Rawhide packages rebuilt for F20 on my personal server, haven't tested on RHEL at all.
sorry, wrong bug reference. Correct one is https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/7778 .

Apart from above issue there are just a few runtime deps missing on el6:

Error: Package: owncloud-6.0.3-1.el6.noarch (/owncloud-6.0.3-1.el6.noarch)
           Requires: php-pear(Sabre_CalDAV) >= 1.7.8
           Available: php-sabredav-Sabre_CalDAV-1.6.4-3.el6.noarch (epel)
               php-pear(Sabre_CalDAV) = 1.6.4
Error: Package: owncloud-6.0.3-1.el6.noarch (/owncloud-6.0.3-1.el6.noarch)
           Requires: php-irodsphp
Error: Package: owncloud-6.0.3-1.el6.noarch (/owncloud-6.0.3-1.el6.noarch)
           Requires: php-pear(Sabre_CardDAV) >= 1.7.8
           Available: php-sabredav-Sabre_CardDAV-1.6.5-2.el6.noarch (epel)
               php-pear(Sabre_CardDAV) = 1.6.5
Error: Package: owncloud-6.0.3-1.el6.noarch (/owncloud-6.0.3-1.el6.noarch)
           Requires: php-pear(phpseclib.sourceforge.net/Net_SFTP)

I'm gonna push a build into updates-testing where we can assemble the update and issue any missing packages. Btw. I don't think the postgresql problem is blocking as long as mysql and sqlite works. maybe we should just drop the pgsql subpkg for the time being until it works again?
then what's our story for people with deployed instances with pgsql databases? migrate your database? stay on 4.x?

well, switch to mysql or stay on 4. We just can't ship an unsupported version of owncloud until the end of time. Is there some nice way to block the update for pgsql users? Maybe set a silly versioned req to owncloud-base in owncloud-pgsql?

notes:
This update provides ownCloud 6 for EL6. Ideally I'd rather actually do ownCloud 5, but I don't think I can go back, since OC 6 was already submitted. Upgrading from 4.5 directly to 6 may not work: if you have a 4.5 install you wish to upgrade I would recommend first upgrading to ownCloud 5 from my repository at https://www.happyassassin.net/temp/oc5_repo (wget https://www.happyassassin.net/temp/oc5_repo/oc5.repo in /etc/yum.repos.d/ ).

However you upgrade, *please* back up your user data, ownCloud configuration and database before running the upgrade.

IMPORTANT NOTE for those using the PostgreSQL database backend: ownCloud 6 requires PostgreSQL 9.0 or higher. The official EL 6 repositories contain only 8.4. You will need to use a remote server or third-party PostgreSQL 9.0 packages. If this presents a major problem for you, please get in touch, and we can look into possibilities, but I'm figuring probably most folks will have moved up to 9.x some way or another.

ownCloud 4.5 is no longer supported upstream and is known to have security vulnerabilities: a major version upgrade is required to keep the package maintainable.

The new ownCloud requires a newer SabreDAV, so this update provides the latest SabreDAV 1.7. This is an API-incompatible update to SabreDAV 1.6, but it cannot be avoided, and there is no package other than ownCloud which depends on SabreDAV in the official or EPEL repositories.

The changes between ownCloud 4.5 and 6.0 are far too numerous to list specifically: see the upstream site and the package changelog for more details.
